title: index out of bounds with async and Fn

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust type TranslateFn = Box String>; pub struct DeviceCluster { devices: Vec, } impl DeviceCluster { pub async fn do_something(&mut self) -> Result> { let mut last_error: Box; for device in &mut self.devices { match device.do_something().await { Ok(info) => { return Ok(info); } Err(e) => {} } } Err(last_error) } } pub struct Device { translate_fn: Option, } impl Device { pub async fn do_something(&mut self) -> Result> { Ok(String::from("")) } } fn main() {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.66.0-nightly (a24a020e6 2022-10-18) binary: rustc commit-hash: a24a020e6d926dffe6b472fc647978f92269504e commit-date: 2022-10-18 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.66.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.2 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 32', /Users/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/ena-0.14.0/src/snapshot_vec.rs:199:10 ```
Backtrace
